RelatedSentence: Dear Editor , For the last 20 years , Guyana has failed to convene Local Government Elections ( LGE ) , even though it is lawfully due every three years .
This model of development can not continue and will inevitably set Guyana up for failure and degradation .
Since 1994 , we have witnessed the deterioration and even disbandment of many Neighbourhood Democratic Councils ( NDCs ) and City and Town Councils .
This is certainly not a scenario I envision for my family , my community , my nation or myself as we move into the future .

Since 1992 , we have undergone four general elections , of which there were no complaints about lack of public education as being a deterrent of holding those elections and no one cared if the citizens were ready or not .

Article 71 of the Constitution , states that Local Government is a vital aspect of democracy and shall be organized so as to involve as many people as possible in the task of managing and developing the communities in which they live .

For this purpose , the said Article 71 of the Constitution also states that Parliament shall provide for a country - wide system of Local Government through the establishment of organs of local democratic power as an integral part of the political organisation of the state .
